headline: Levi Strauss stock jumps on earnings beat, raised guidance
summary: Levi Strauss (LEVI) reported better-than-expected second quarter results. Adjusted earnings of $0.22 per share was better than the Bloomberg consensus estimate of $0.13. Revenue was $1.45 billion versus an estimate of $1.37 billion. The company also raised its full-year profit and revenue guidance. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma reports the breaking news. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Tesla has not yet applied for robotaxi permits in California, state regulators say
summary: (Reuters) -Tesla has yet to apply for regulatory permits it needs to operate driverless taxis in California, two state regulators said on Thursday, a day after CEO Elon Musk said the company would expand its robotaxis to the San Francisco Bay Area within two months.  "To date, Tesla has not applied for either a driverless testing or deployment permit," a spokesperson for California's Department of Motor Vehicles said in an email to Reuters on Thursday.  The California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC), which in March issued the first in a series of permits Tesla requires, said on Thursday the company had not yet applied for any new permits.

raw.headline: Tesla has not yet applied for robotaxi permits in California, state regulators say
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Tesla has yet to apply for regulatory permits it needs to operate driverless taxis in California, two state regulators said on Thursday, a day after CEO Elon Musk said the company would expand its robotaxis to the San Francisco Bay Area within two months.  "To date, Tesla has not applied for either a driverless testing or deployment permit," a spokesperson for California's Department of Motor Vehicles said in an email to Reuters on Thursday.  The California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC), which in March issued the first in a series of permits Tesla requires, said on Thursday the company had not yet applied for any new permits.

headline: Lockheed Stock Falls on Downgrade. It’s Losing Wall Street Support.
summary: Lockheed  Martin stock dropped early Thursday after catching a Wall Street downgrade.  TD Cowen analyst Gautam Khanna downgraded shares of the defense contractor to Hold from Buy, citing uncertainty about prospects for its F-35 jet under the second Trump administration and “fairly persistent execution challenges.”  Lockheed’s loss of the F-47 sixth-generation fighter jet program to  Boeing  —announced in March—will result in some additional expenses, he says, adding there have been “cost overruns on a classified aero program.”

headline: Tesla to hold annual shareholder meeting in November
summary: STORY: Tesla confirmed Thursday (July 10) it will hold its annual shareholder meeting on November 6.The electric vehicle giant's announcement comes a day after a group of investors urged it to set a date and cited legal obligations.The last meeting was held in June 2024 and since then a series of events have hurt Tesla's stock.Those include CEO Elon Musk's public feud with President Donald Trump.And the end of EV tax credits and a slump in sales due to an ageing vehicle lineup.It has all raised investor concerns and Tesla shares have lost 38% since hitting a record high in December.The automaker also wants to pivot to self-driving technologies for future growth.Investors worry Musk's political ambitions could hurt Tesla after he recently launched the 'America Party'Tesla's board set July 31 as the new deadline for the submission of shareholder proposals to be included in the proxy statement.The carmaker was close to missing a deadline under Texas law.It allows investors to seek legal option in case a company fails to hold a shareholder meeting within 13 months of holding a previous one.

raw.headline: Tesla to hold annual shareholder meeting in November
raw.summary: STORY: Tesla confirmed Thursday (July 10) it will hold its annual shareholder meeting on November 6.The electric vehicle giant's announcement comes a day after a group of investors urged it to set a date and cited legal obligations.The last meeting was held in June 2024 and since then a series of events have hurt Tesla's stock.Those include CEO Elon Musk's public feud with President Donald Trump.And the end of EV tax credits and a slump in sales due to an ageing vehicle lineup.It has all raised investor concerns and Tesla shares have lost 38% since hitting a record high in December.The automaker also wants to pivot to self-driving technologies for future growth.Investors worry Musk's political ambitions could hurt Tesla after he recently launched the 'America Party'Tesla's board set July 31 as the new deadline for the submission of shareholder proposals to be included in the proxy statement.The carmaker was close to missing a deadline under Texas law.It allows investors to seek legal option in case a company fails to hold a shareholder meeting within 13 months of holding a previous one.

headline: Prediction: Buying Lucid Group Stock Today Could Set You Up for Life
summary: If you want to add significant upside potential to your portfolio, check out electric car stocks.  In 2021, electric vehicles (EVs) represented just 3.4% of all vehicle sales in the U.S. By 2030, however, nearly 30% of all vehicle sales are expected to be electric.  While plenty of risks remain, Lucid Group (NASDAQ: LCID) could very well be the next Tesla, potentially generating huge wealth for your portfolio in the process.

headline: Tesla Expands Robo-Taxi Service. What It Means for the Stock.
summary: Tesla  stock rose early Thursday as CEO Elon Musk revealed development plans for his company’s self-driving taxi service.  “Expanding to a larger service area in Austin this weekend,” explained Musk, adding that launching in the San Francisco Bay Area was likely “in a month or two.”  Today, it has a permit to test self-driving cars with a safety driver in the state.

headline: Tesla announces November annual meeting under pressure from shareholders
summary: Tesla has scheduled an annual shareholders meeting for November, one day after the electric vehicle company came under pressure from major shareholders to do so.  Billionaire Elon Musk's company said in a regulatory filing on Thursday that the meeting will be held on Nov. 6.  A group of more than 20 Tesla shareholders said in a letter to the company a day earlier that it needed to provide public notice of the annual meeting.
